Class Connect4Logic

java.lang.Object
core.Connect4Logic
public class Connect4Logic extends Object
The Connect4Logic class contains the game logic for the Connect 4 game. It manages the game board, validates moves, checks win/draw conditions, and updates the game state.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Connect4Logic()
    Constructor to initialize the Connect 4 game board and set the starting player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Connect4Logic

      public Connect4Logic()
      Constructor to initialize the Connect 4 game board and set the starting player.

  • Method Details

    • makeMove

      public boolean makeMove(int column)
      Makes a move for the current player in the specified column.
      Parameters:
      column - The column (0-based index) where the player wants to drop their piece.
      Returns:
      true if the move is successful, false otherwise.

    • checkWin

      public boolean checkWin()
      Checks if the current player has won the game.
      Returns:
      true if the current player has a line of 4, false otherwise.

    • switchPlayer

      public void switchPlayer()
      changes the current player between 'X' and 'O'.

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard()
      Displays the current state of the board.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public char getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the current player.
      Returns:
      The character representing the current player ('X' or 'O').

    • isBoardFull

      public boolean isBoardFull()
      Checks if the board is completely filled with no empty spaces.
      Returns:
      true if the board is full, false otherwise.
